text: Georgy Mshvenieradze (born 12 August 1960, in Tbilisi, Georgian SSR) is a Soviet water polo player. His father Peter was the captain of the USSR team throughout the 1950s and appeared at three Olympic Games. Georgy and his brother Nugzar followed their father into the sport. ==See also== * List of Olympic champions in men's water polo * List of Olympic medalists in water polo * List of world champions in men's water polo * List of World Aquatics Championships medalists in water polo == References == ==External links== * Category:1960 births Category:Living people Category:Male water polo players from Georgia (country) Category:Olympic water polo players of the Soviet Union Category:Water polo players at the 1980 Summer Olympics Category:Water polo players at the 1988 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic gold medalists for the Soviet Union Category:Olympic bronze medalists for the Soviet Union Category:Olympic medalists in water polo Category:Sportspeople from Tbilisi Category:Medalists at the 1988 Summer Olympics Category:Medalists at the 1980 Summer Olympics
title: Giorgi Mshvenieradze
